title: As Sophos is bought by a US bidder, why is Britain unable to keep hold of its tech darlings?
text:
It’s easy to cringe at the notorious 2007 Fortune magazine photoshoot of the so-called “PayPal mafia.”

The 13 men dressed as characters from the television series The Sopranos, pretending to drink and gamble together but looking like they’d rather be anywhere else, have become a symbol of Silicon Valley’s start-up wealth flowing to a new generation of firms.

The men worked at online payments firm PayPal and all went on to become investors or founders at other firms such as YouTube, LinkedIn, Yelp and Yammer, raising their collective net wealth to billions of dollars.

For entrepreneurs in the UK and Europe, the PayPal Mafia have become a guiding star. But on this side of the Atlantic, establishing...
description: It’s easy to cringe at the notorious 2007 Fortune magazine photoshoot of the so-called “PayPal mafia.
